p: The immune and memory response to the booster dose and the post-booster geometric mean titer, are independent of the interval since initial vaccination [ 27]. In one study, the effect of the booster on seroprotection was the same across all sexes and age-groups, and the longest time interval between initial dose and booster dose was 11 years, indicating that booster dose can be highly immunogenic for up to 11 years after primary vaccination [ 27].
